snippet: A new study by a French aid agency said the cold claimed more lives than originally thought.
abstract: Study by French aid agency Solidarites International says that the harsh winter in Afghanistan that had killed children in refugee camps and brought attention to poor conditions there was more extensive than originally thought, with at least 100 young children claimed by the cold. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan -- After a harsh winter killed children in refugee camps around the Afghan capital and brought attention to poor conditions there, a new study by a French aid agency said the disaster was more extensive than originally thought, with at least 100 young children claimed by the cold. The study, carried out in March by the French aid group Solidarités International, sought to collect information from families at all of the 45 camps in or near Kabul, according to Julie Bara, who conducted the survey for the group, one of few international relief agencies that have long been active in the camps.

headline.main: Afghan Refugee Children Perish in Harsh Winter
